div1.p: Hench requests that Crenshaw contact Moran.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to [s.n.] Crenshaw, July 13, 1938
div1.p:
You remember, some months ago I showed you a letter from John
J. Moran, one of the yellow fever volunteers on the Reed commission. He
wanted to be remembered to you, and you told me that you were going to
write him, even though you did not remember him. I told him this, but
apparently the matter slipped your mind. In a recent letter the following
paragraph appears:

“With reference to Dr. Crenshaw. It was foolish of me to think
that he would remember me. We were classmates for one year only and he
was not one of those whom I intimately knew. I think the best thing we
can do is to forget all about one another since we have but one thing in
common, viz: that we are both members of the UVA Alumnae.”
I am sure he will appreciate hearing from you.
